des:
With Atomberg skill and Alexa, you can now interact with your Atomberg smart fans by voice. You can use Alexa to turn the fan ON or OFF, change the speed, enable sleep mode, and turn the fan light on or off. For fans that support light brightness and color change functionality, you can change also control the fan light brightness and color using Alexa. To get started, 
1. Connect your Atomberg smart fans to WiFi using the Atomberg Home app.
2. Enable Atomberg Home skill:
a. Method 1: Navigate to the ‘More’ section in the Atomberg Home app and click on the ‘Connect’ button next to ‘Amazon Alexa’. Please note: If you purchased your Alexa device in the USA/ your Alexa marketplace is set to the US region, please use the method 2 below.
b. Method 2: Search for ‘Atomberg Home’ skill in the Alexa ‘Skills and Games’ section and click on ‘Enable Now’. 
3. You may be asked to login to your Atomberg Home account during the linking process. Please ensure that you use the same login method (Google/ Apple/ Facebook/ Email) and credentials used on the Atomberg Home app
4. Once the account is linked, you can give voice commands to the fans by using the name of the fan set in the Atomberg Home app. For example, if you have named your fan as ‘Smart Fan’ in the Atomberg Home app, your command to start the fan should be “Alexa, turn on Smart Fan”. To change the name of the fan, please rename the fans in the Atomberg Home app. The updated name will automatically reflect in the Alexa app.

You can check the following video for understanding the Alexa linking process: https://resources.atomberg-iot.com/alexa_linking.html
